fields.description: *Assessment* DescribeInstances calls against Eucalyptus's EC2 API service doesn't return "architecture" in its response. This affects EC2 tools that expect to see that value present. "architecture" is part of the contents of the [RunningInstancesItemType|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-RunningInstancesItemType.html] data type. {code} $ 2014-03-10T17:41:31.831Z LayinDaSmackDown monitoring-disabled 10.104.7.13 172.17.112.23 instance-store hvm {code} *Steps* * Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.2 or 4.0.0 cloud * Launch an instance (instance store-backed, EBS-backed) using an i386 or x86_64 EMI. * Make a DescribeInstances API call and observe contents returned *Pertinent Data* This currently affects Packer's ability to create instance store-backed EMIs in Eucalyptus. [~eucacolby] has more information regarding this.
fields.summary: Should support "architecture" in EC2 DescribeInstances Response

comments.body: We'd need to ensure that the architecture is available for terminated instances, i.e. ones no longer associated with an image. We may need to keep a redundant copy of the architecture in the VmBootRecord as is now done for other image properties that are needed for the instance. This should be done in a way that avoids the need for an upgrade task if possible.

git branch: dev/ethomas/EUCA-9002

git show 63397d580b72b7c546c0517c2c8fabfc2970076f

Added "architecture" field to RunningInstancesItemType, added the field to the appropriate WSDL's as well.  Populated the field by checking against the emi id in the instance and cross referencing it against the images table in the db.  One lookup per set of instances returned to avoid too many connections.  Ideally this information might be in the instances table, but this solution avoids db changes to not require upgrade work.
We cannot rely on the image being available once the instance is terminated, it is therefore necessary to track the architecture as part of the metadata for the instance.

[~sjones]The image_id field is still in the instances table when the instance is terminated, when would an image be unavailable?  Is there a use case where an image is deleted after instances are terminated?
[~ethomas], when an image is not in use it can be deleted (by a cloud user)

git branch dev/ethomas/EUCA-9002-3
git show 9b8bc9f70929c5c7fa81ab84d1e00634656ed88d

Added architecture field to RunningInstancesItemType (also changed appropriate ec2-instance-binding.xml) and VmBootRecord.java, initial value in VmBootRecord.java is populated from the BootableImageInfo (also added getArchitecture() here).  

If VmBootRecord.getArchitecture() value is null (shouldn't be) will return x86_64 and log a warning.  

During instance termination, if VmBootRecord.getArchitecture() is null, it is populated from the BootableImageInfo record  [This avoids the need for upgrade code].  Upgrade shoud still be tested, as usual, however.
The fix looks good to me.

Verified that we now return the architecture: {noformat} Even though we return '<architecture>' in the response, we fail to display the architecture in the output.

*Eucalyptus 4.0*
{code}

{code}

*AWS*
{code}
$ aws ec2 describe-instances --profile harold-work

Let's track the output issue in TOOLS-489.
